organic_results.title: Effects of cooperative learning teams on student achievement and race relations: Treatment by race interactions
organic_results.snippet: Cooperative learning methods, in which students work in small, heterogeneous learning teams to master academic materials, have been found in a series of studies to significantly improve student achievement, race relations, and other outcomes. However, one issue concerning these effects has not been resolved; do they occur equally for black and white students, or does learning cooperatively disproportionately benefit one race or the other? This study investigates treatment x race interactions in ten integrated middle school English …
